name: Grand Cayman Beach Suites

reviews.title: Not up to par
reviews.text: We have stayed in many Hyatts. We recently visited the Hyatt Grand Cayman...It was extremely overpriced and it was not up to par with other Hyatts. The bottom of the deck chairs were covered with mold. There were chunks of plaster missing from the bottom of the pool. The island is still trying to recover from Ivan over a year ago, and many services were still not in operation. Next time, we will go back to Hawaii where things are impeccable. Very disappointed in the huge amount of money we spent for a second rate vacation.
My wife and I just returned from a week (1/9/06 -1/13/06) at the Hyatt on Grand Cayman. We’re recent “empty nesters”: we travel a good deal and usually stay at Hyatt Hotels as Gold Passport Members.
reviews.title: Should have read more reviews
Its a dump
reviews.text: We needed a quick get-away and I booked this vacation hastily without my normal due diligence. Big mistake.

Review the hotel web page very, very carefully. Note that a small portion of this resort hotel is on the beach (only 53 “beach” suites). Note that the rest of the hotel - including the spa area, golf course and numerous other amenities-is across the street from the beach side suites. This portion of the hotel is gone/closed/damaged by Hurricane Ivan.

not what others have said
reviews.text: Be aware that the building across the street that houses the standard rooms has not reopened since Hurricane Ivan. The property is fenced off and no work is being done on it.

Only the building housing the beachfront suites is open. The building seems to have been completely renovated with no signs of hurricane damage to it. There's a small reception area at the entrance. One of the 2 young ladies at the front desk took care of us right away (very nice young lady).
reviews.title: Great Place Great Price
LOVED THE HYATT
reviews.text: Our lovely suite was located on the 4th floor. When you open the front door, there's a long hallway.

We just got back from a Week at the Hyatt. It was a great trip, Cayman is a perfect destination for divers. Short flight from Atlanta, zipped through customs and a 5 minute drive from the airport. We left Atlanta at 10:20 and were on the beach by 1:00 their time.
reviews.title: Expensive and worth it
Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!
reviews.text: As for the Hyatt, we stayed in the beachfront section, it is the only section open right now so I can't speak for the other part of the property but it did seem like a hike to the beach. And for such a large resort this hotel only has what felt like 50 yards of beachfront. But right now with only part of it open it was perfect. They have the neatest Beach chairs I have ever seen and I have stayed in about 10 Carribean islands. And chairs were always available right now. Room was super clean and spacious with a fridge and microwave, coffee maker with coffee replaced daily. Pool is very nice with varying levels of depth, you can sit in it and read for example. Staff and service are second to none really. If you are researching the Caymans then you already know how expensive food and drink are but it was still a shock to us. Especially the restaraunts within the Hyatt, 50 bucks US for breakfast for 2 for example, but it was a darn good breakfast.

This offset by the 1/4 mile walk to a full size grocery store and very short walk to a great variety of restaraunts. If you want a cheap american lunch and some beers, Lone star is 100 yards away. Deckers right across the street was a very nice meal at dinner, great food, but with a cheap bottle of Australian wine (yeech by the way, stick with California wine) our bill was 150 US for 2. Best restaraunt in both food quality and price was the Reef Grill about 1/4 of a mile south right on the water. Ragazzis' was also a great Italian right across the street.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation
Fantastic Hyatt Honeymoon...
reviews.text: Have not read all the reviews but the best thing about this hotel is Red Sail sports, if you are diving. The headquarters is right on the beach in this hotel. I have been on 50+ dives in my life and never been on nicer dive boats or with a better staff. They are a little more expensive than some dive shops but you walk 30 feet from your room, hop on the boat, your gear has already been loaded, you ride 10 minutes to the site, great overview with sketches from the dive master, and you are underwater. And the deep dives are guided at no extra cost. Compared to many dive situations I have been on where you ride 30-45 minutes on a shuttle, then load the boat, then ride 45 minutes to a dive site, by the time you get home your day is over. If you are trying to save money diving, spend you cash going to the North wall with Redsail. West wall you can almost shore dive. North wall is a longer ride but the canal means the boat is only a 2 minute drive from the hotel and again all your stuff is ready.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: After three vacations in Maui, we decided to do something different and headed to the Carribean. We stayed at the Hyatt and were disappointed. Overall, the resort lacked sparkle and seemed to need updating. The beach area was minimal and was a long, long walk from the resort. However, the Carribean water itself is truly amazing. The breakfast was your basic business travel grade fare; watered down concentrate orange juice, bad coffee, lackluster menu. Our room decor was bad Florida 70's; auqua and hot pink tropical fish shower curtain, cheezy polyester green bed spread with big palm leaf decorations, flat overly-used foam pillows, just bad. And I might add, not large and not especially clean. There were NO TOUCHES of luxury in the room. The gardens were pretty. The pool was fine although they NEVER had clean towels. On two days we waited for 2 hours or more for towels. And the drinks were expensive and watery made with good 'ole Cosco Drink Mix rather than fresh fruits and juices. All of this for a hefty price tag and we were disappointed.

reviews.title: A Travel Agents perspective
reviews.text: Contrast this with the Maui where we stayed twice at Kapaluah and once at the Fairmont Kei Lani.....amazing staff, luxury, breath-taking beauty.

reviews.title: good trip with friendly service
reviews.text: Well, to start off, the Hyatt is a beautiful hotel. The grounds are absolutely lovely. Everyone at the hotel was more than friendly. The concierge was fabulous, this should be your first stop! They have maps of the island, where to find the best snorkeling spots, along with dive locations.

reviews.title: Hyatt & Grand Cayman are fabulous!
reviews.text: I absolutely do not recommend eating at the Hyatt! But, if you have a lot of money to throw around, all the better, eat at the Hyatt then. If you are on a budget like I am, eat at the restaurant right NEXT DOOR. It's called Lonestar, no, it's not the Lonestar Steak House that you might be thinking here in the states. But, Lonestar is a steakhouse owned by a guy from Texas. It has steak, burgers, fries, just about everything you want, only at a decent price. Plus there is no automatic 15% gratuity charged to the bill like the Hyatt (at least I don't remember one at Lonestar).

reviews.title: Beware of the critters!
reviews.text: Another thing about the Hyatt, do not go by the pictures you see on their website. They show the front of the building on the beach. However, there are several buildings. One is on the beach, then there is a bridge that crosses the street to where the main section of the hotel. Now the oceanview is probably really nice, but the better swimming pool is in the main area of the hotel. Not the section of the property that is on the beach. But, who needs a pool when you got the beach...Ohh ya, that's right, you need a pool at night! ;-)

aka: Grand Cayman Beach Hotel Seven Mile Beach
description: The Grand Cayman Beach Suites is the island's finest all-suites beach and golf resort. The 800 sq. ft. suites have spectacular views of the Caribbean Sea, famous Seven Mile beach and our uniquely designed swimming pools. The hotel resort offers exclusive facilities within the complex, 24/7 fitness center, deluxe European boutique spa, water sports facilities, on site dive center, catamaran trips and a Jack Nicklaus designed golf course.
